The state legislature is on the verge of an important smart justice reform.
Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

At the height of the failed war on drugs, Pennsylvania enacted a law that requires the Department of Transportation to automatically suspend the driver's license of anyone convicted of certain non-driving offenses such as drug possession, carrying a fake ID, and underage purchase of tobacco.

Suspending a driver's license for offenses that don't involve a vehicle does nothing to improve or protect public safety, and, worse, it creates obstacles that set people up to fail.

The state Senate is on the verge of passing a bill to repeal this unfair and senseless sanction. Please contact your state senator and ask them to vote YES on this legislation.

A driver's license plays a critical role in ensuring that people can get their lives back on track after a conviction. By taking that license away, the commonwealth creates unnecessary obstacles to viable employment opportunities and the ability to participate in family life.

The bill to repeal the driver's license suspension has already passed the state House. Please tell your state senator to vote YES on this bill!

In liberty,

Elizabeth Randol
Legislative Director, ACLU of Pennsylvania
